intro: Tristagma brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed tristagma, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, while its stems are slender and branching. Tristagma brevipes is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
